docs.summary: The wix-dashboard module contains functionality for interacting with your site's dashboard in the code for dashboard pages.
description: The Wix Dashboard API allows the code in [dashboard pages](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-dashboard-pages) to interact with the Wix dashboard enviroment.
Using the module you can:
- Navigate users to other pages in the dashboard.
- Display toasts.
<!-- Retrieve data about changes to the dashboard's state and use it to update your page in real time. -->
To use the Wix Dashboard API, import the applicable function from `wix-dashboard`:
```js
import { <function> } from 'wix-dashboard';
## Before you begin
It's important to note that the Wix Dashboard API can only be used in the page code files for dashboard pages. The functions in this API won't work in any other code files on your site.

params.name: pageId
params.doc: ID of the page to navigate to. Use the [Dashboard Page IDs](#dashboard-page-ids) table to find the appropriate ID.

docs.summary: Navigates the user to another page in the dashboard.
description: > This function can only be used in page code files for [dashboard pages](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-dashboard-pages).
If an invalid `pageId` value is passed to this function, a **Page Not Found** message is displayed in the dashboard.

examples.title: Navigate to the dashboard home page

description: > This function can only be used in page code files for [dashboard pages](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-dashboard-pages).
The `showToast()` function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing a function called remove.
The `remove()` function removes the toast from the page.
Use the `config` parameter to:
* Control the toast's appearance.
* Set callback functions to run when the user sees or clicks on the toast.
* Create a clickable call-to-action that displays in the toast.
Requests to display toasts may be queued and the toast may not be displayed immediately.

> **Note:** When the timeout parameter is set to `none` the toast is rendered into the page layout and pushes the rest of the page down. When timeout is set to `normal`, the toast appears on top of other content on the page.

examples.title: Display a success toast when a product is updated
Display an error toast with a 'Learn more' link
Remove a displayed toast
body: /* Promise resolves a function that removes the toast. */

members.name: text
members.doc: Text that appears in the call-to-action.

members.name: removeToastOnClick
members.doc: Whether to remove the toast after the call-to-action is clicked.

members.name: onClick
members.doc: Callback function to run after the call-to-action is clicked.

members.name: message
members.doc: Text that appears in the toast.

members.name: timeout
members.doc:
Whether the toast removes itself or not. 

Options: `none`, `normal`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Toast color and message type. 

Options: 
- `standard`: Blue toast. 
- `success`: Green toast.  
- `warning`: Yellow warning toast.
- `error`: Red error toast.

members.name: priority
members.doc:
Priority of the toast. If several toasts are triggered at the same time, they're displayed in the order of their priority levels. 
Options: `low`, `normal`, `high`.

members.name: action
members.doc: Object representing a call-to-action that is displayed in the toast.

members.name: onCloseClick
members.doc: Callback function to run when the toast is closed by clicking its close button.

members.name: onToastSeen
members.doc: Callback function to run when the toast is seen by the user.
